results.title: Dealing with Alzheimer's Disease: a commonsense approach to communication
results.creator_credit: Karen Feldt, Ramsey Foundation and Terra Nova
results.brief_description: Alzheimer’s Disease often produces memory loss and gradual changes in abilities to think, plan and communicate. Family members who are caregivers are often frustrated by these losses. This video is designed to help caregivers by providing information about these losses, teaching verbal and non-verbal communication techniques, describing common behaviour changes and providing suggestions to prevent or reduce problem behaviours.

results.title: Deakin's pipe dream
results.brief_description:
A montage of archival photographic images superimposed with live action footage to present a vision of Federation and irrigation in the Sunraysia region of Victoria. Without dialogue and accompanied only by background sound effects.
Developed during the Alfred Deakin Federation Project, 2001 and supported by the Centenary of Federation Victoria and the Community Support Fund through the Victorian Federation Grants Scheme, and the Mildura City Council.

results.title: Deaf Culture (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Adult Hearing Centre for Deaf and Hearing Impaired Persons
results.brief_description: Hearing people ask: What is it? What does it mean? Can we really speak about Deaf culture? Steve Ripley knows the worlds of the hearing and the deaf. He has travelled widely and tells his experiences in vivid sign language. A voice interpreter and subtitles are provided for those not fluent in sign language.

results.title: Days of destruction
results.brief_description: Examines and chronicles the January, 1973 eruption of the volcano Eldfell on the Icelandic island of Aeimaey. Shows how scientists studied the eruption and documents the civil defence personnel and towns people as they attempted to save buildings from approaching lava flow. Depicts the evacuation of the 5,000 inhabitants, both by air and sea. Graphically captures scenes of bellowing craters, flowing lava and burning and collapsing buildings.

results.title: Dax's Case
results.brief_description: This documentary raised vital questions about a patient’s right to choose whether to live or die, and about the role of the medical and legal profession. In 1973 Dax Cowart, a former air force pilot, was the victim of an explosion which left him blind, disfigured and suffering excruciating pain from severe burns. Despite persistent pleas to be allowed to die, Dax was kept alive. Now, leading a full life, he still maintains that he should have been allowed to die.

results.title: Dates
results.creator_credit: Donovan Miller and Hollywood Film Enterprises
results.brief_description: Date growing in the Coachella Valley of Southern California. Outlines the history of date cultivation in the region; shows artificial pollination, harvesting, grading and packing of the fruit.

results.title: Darwin was right!
results.brief_description: Fun and games with the animals at the Goologul Gardens including seals, bears and monkeys. Focusses mainly on chimpanzees with footage of them at various “human” activities - playing drums, fiddling with a hand-cranked camera, bathing a baby etc.

results.title: Danish porcelain
results.creator_credit: Gunnar Robert Hansen and Dansk Kulturfilm
results.brief_description: After tracing the history of porcelain from ancient China, shows all stages of production in the Royal Danish Porcelain Factory, and in the Bing and Grondahl Factory. Shows specimens of modern Danish ceramic art.
